casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America, on the Relation of Emil Henry CARSTENS, Relator-Appellant, v. Rudolph REIMER, Commissioner of Immigration, Port of New York, RespondentAppellee. No. 24. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit Oct. 21, 1935. Maurice B. Gladstone, of New York City, for appellant. F. W. H. Adams, U. S. Atty., of New York City (David W. Wainhouse and Malcolm A. Crusius, Asst. U. S. Attys., both of New York City, of counsel), for appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and SWAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Affirmed on the authority of Smith v. United States, 289 U.S. 744, 53 S.Ct. 687, 77 L.Ed. 1490, and United States ex rel. Karpay v. Uhl (C.C.A.) 70 F.(2d) 792.
